Method Detail

callOfPackageBoundaryPointcut

public static boolean callOfPackageBoundaryPointcut(java.lang.Object calledObj,
                                                    java.lang.Object callerObj)
Pointcut intercepting the call of methods non private and non static to the classes annotated with the InjectedPkgBoundary annotations. 
  AspectJ pointcut:
   call(!private !static * 
   (@com.google.code.aoplib4j.aspectj.modularity.InjectedPkgBoundary *)
      .*(..)) 
   && target(calledObj) && this(callerObj) && if()

Parameters:
calledObj - instance of the called object.
callerObj - instance of the caller object.
Returns:
false if the callerObj and calledObj have are on the same package or if the callerObj and calledObj are the same instance, true otherwise.

callOfPackageBoundaryAdvice

public void callOfPackageBoundaryAdvice(java.lang.Object calledObj,
                                        java.lang.Object callerObj,
                                        org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint jp)
Advice for the execution of the thiscallOfPackageBoundaryPointcut(Object, Object) pointcut. The advice retrieve the package of the caller object (using callerObj parameter) and the package of the called object (using the calledObj parameter) and then do a violation check. See packageBoundaryViolated(PackageBoundary, String) for more information about the boundary violation check. In the case of a violation, the framework creates an instance of BoundaryViolationCallback (using as implementation class taken from PackageBoundary.callbackClass()) and call the callback method #boundaryViolation( com.google.code.aoplib4j.aspectj.modularity.ViolationInformation) .

Parameters:
calledObj - the called object.
callerObj - the caller object.
jp - aspectj joinpoint object.

callOfStaticPackageBoundaryPointcut

public static boolean callOfStaticPackageBoundaryPointcut(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
Pointcut intercepting the call of methods non private and static to the classes annotated with the InjectedPkgBoundary annotations. 
  AspectJ pointcut:
    call(!private static * 
    (@com.google.code.aoplib4j.aspectj.modularity.InjectedPkgBoundary *)
      .*(..))

Parameters:
jpsp - AspectJ join point static part.
Returns:
false if the PackageBoundary annotation retrieved from the called class package is null, true otherwise.

callOfStaticPackageBoundaryAdvice

public void callOfStaticPackageBoundaryAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
Advice executed before of the callOfStaticPackageBoundaryPointcut( org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart) pointcut. The advice retrieve the called informations using the JoinPoint.StaticPart object and the package called object . Since static pointcuts cannot retrieve the caller object using this pointcut, the caller object information is computed using the stack trace of the current execution thread (by creating a new Throwable object and calling Throwable.getStackTrace()). After having the packages of the caller and the called object a violation check is made.See packageBoundaryViolated(PackageBoundary, String) for more information about the boundary violation check. In the case of a violation, the framework creates an instance of BoundaryViolationCallback (using as implementation class taken from PackageBoundary.callbackClass()) and call the callback method #boundaryViolation( com.google.code.aoplib4j.aspectj.modularity.ViolationInformation)

Parameters:
jpsp - AspectJ join point static part.
See Also:
packageBoundaryViolated(PackageBoundary, String)

packageBoundaryViolated

private boolean packageBoundaryViolated(PackageBoundary pkgBoundary,
                                        java.lang.String callerObjPackage)
Verifies the violation of package boundary by retrieving the information from the PackageBoundary annotation (the packages list, the list type) and comparing with the package name of the caller class.

Parameters:
pkgBoundary - PackageBoundary annotation.
callerObjPackage - caller object package.
Returns:
true if a boundary violation; false otherwise.
